content.question: An open switch is in series with an inductor, a resistor, and a battery. At time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> the switch is closed. The rate at which the resistor dissipates energy is <math alttext="the derivative of E with respect to t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math>. Which of the following statements correctly indicates how <math alttext="the derivative of E with respect to t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math> changes over time, and provides a correct justification?

choices.label: <math alttext="the derivative of E with respect to t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math> does not change because the current in the resistor is constant.

<math alttext="the derivative of E with respect to t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math> does not change because the resistor is connected to a battery with a constant potential difference.

<math alttext="the derivative of E with respect to t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math> increases because the potential difference across the inductor increases over time.

<math alttext="the derivative of E with respect to t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math> increases because the current in the resistor increases over time.

content.answer: <math alttext="the derivative of E with respect to t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math> increases because the current in the resistor increases over time.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
